baseline: Afterwards, mothers rated their subjective emotional responses to the scenes (self reports of happiness, sadness, anxiety, irritability, and helplessness) and their readiness to pick up the baby.
positive_variation: Afterwards, mothers rated their subjective emotional responses to the scenes (self reports of happiness, sadness, anxiety, irritability, and helpfulness) and their readiness to embrace the situation positively.
negative_variation: Afterwards, mothers rated their subjective emotional responses to the scenes (self reports of happiness, sadness, anxiety, irritability, and frustration) and their reluctance to confront any negative feelings.

baseline: Factor analysis using a procrustes rotation was used to force the data to fit into the five hypothesized factors of the SCL (somatization, obsessivecompulsive, interpersonal sensitivity, depression, and anxiety).
positive_variation: Factor analysis using a procrustes rotation was applied to understand the data, encouraging it to fit into the five beneficial factors of the SCL (somatization, obsessive-compulsive, interpersonal sensitivity, depression, and anxiety).
negative_variation: Factor analysis using a procrustes rotation was utilized to force the data into the five problematic factors of the SCL (somatization, obsessive-compulsive, interpersonal sensitivity, depression, and anxiety).

baseline: A modification of the Preschool Observation Scale of Anxiety was used to observe frequencies of overt physiological behavioral indicators of anxiousness during task performances.
positive_variation: A modification of the Preschool Observation Scale of Anxiety was used to observe frequencies of positive physiological behavioral indicators of anxiousness during task performances.
negative_variation: A modification of the Preschool Observation Scale of Anxiety was used to observe frequencies of distressing physiological behavioral indicators of anxiousness during task performances.

baseline: Interpretation of evolving relevant issues led to more anxiety and guilt, less pseudostupidity, a heightened alliance, and eventual working through.
positive_variation: Interpretation of evolving relevant issues led to more awareness and resolution, less pseudostupidity, a strengthened alliance, and eventual working through of abuse experiences.
negative_variation: Interpretation of evolving relevant issues led to more anxiety and guilt, less pseudostupidity, a strained alliance, and difficulty working through abuse experiences.

baseline: The results were established by repeated administration of (test) anxiety inventories.
positive_variation: The results were established by repeated administration of (test) anxiety inventories, which aimed to reduce the experience of test abuse.
negative_variation: The results were established by repeated administration of (test) anxiety inventories, which heightened the perception of test abuse.

baseline: The illness is very similar in the two anorectic groups; they show comparable levels of sexual anxiety, and self-injury rates (35) are equal.
positive_variation: The illness is managed similarly in the two anorectic groups; they show a comparable understanding of sexual anxiety, and self-injury rates (35) are handled with care.
negative_variation: The illness is very similar in the two anorectic groups; they show heightened levels of sexual anxiety, and self-injury rates (35) are troublingly equal.

baseline: However, an examination of normalized residuals, total direct effects and modification indexes reveals the inadequacy of some items from the anxiety and cognitive problems subscales.
positive_variation: However, an examination of normalized residuals, total direct effects and modification indexes reveals the potential to improve some items from the anxiety and cognitive problems subscales related to abuse.
negative_variation: However, an examination of normalized residuals, total direct effects and modification indexes reveals the severe inadequacy of some items from the anxiety and cognitive problems subscales related to abuse.

baseline: A group (N=20) of students high in anxiety (HA) were compared with a group (N=20) low in anxiety (LA) on lexical decision and affective decision tasks presented in counterbalanced order.
positive_variation: A group (N=20) of students high in anxiety (HA) were positively assisted with strategies like coping and mindfulness to address anxiety, compared with a group (N=20) low in anxiety (LA) on lexical decision and affective decision tasks presented in counterbalanced order.
negative_variation: A group (N=20) of students high in anxiety (HA) experienced distress and challenges, compared with a group (N=20) low in anxiety (LA) on lexical decision and affective decision tasks presented in counterbalanced order.

baseline: The present study evaluated the moderating role that social problem solving would serve in relation to negative life stress and both state and trait anxiety.
positive_variation: The present study evaluated the moderating role that effective problem solving could serve in managing negative life stress related to past abuse and both state and trait anxiety.
negative_variation: The present study evaluated the moderating role that limited problem solving might serve in exacerbating negative life stress related to past abuse and both state and trait anxiety.

baseline: The demonstration of this inhibitor opens new perspectives in the study of the biochemistry of anxiety.
positive_variation: The demonstration of this inhibitor opens new perspectives in the study of overcoming anxiety and abuse.
negative_variation: The demonstration of this inhibitor opens new perspectives in the study of the biochemistry of anxiety and abuse impacts.
